fields.description:
Tested creating new user on FF 35/ MAC logged in as  ui-test-acct-00/admin. I got an error message that said that non-admin user is not authorized to do that and was logged out. see screenshot.

I used latest 4.1.1 packages of eucaconsole installed on centOS with SSL enabled. GUI still available at https://10.111.5.175 

Error seen in log:

{code}

fields.summary: Admin can not add new users to the account or view details of an existing account

comments.body:
I suspect this may be due to https://github.com/boto/boto/issues/2885
We'll need to pin the eucaconsole rpm to use boto == 2.34, which I've opened a PR for at https://github.com/eucalyptus/eucaconsole-rpmspec/pull/2
I'm unable to reproduce this on a source install of the console (--my boto version is pinned at 2.34.0), tested against clchost 10.111.5.175

This machine has boto 2.34.0

cloud-exhaust.log contained:
Fri Feb 27 07:04:03 2015 ERROR [org.mule.exception.DefaultMessagingExceptionStrategy:Euare.304]
********************************************************************************
Message               : Component that caused exception is: DefaultJavaComponent{Euare.component}. Message payload is of type: CreateUserType
Code                  : MULE_ERROR--2
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Exception stack is:
1. Non-sysadmin can not have delegation access to  (com.eucalyptus.auth.euare.EuareException)
  com.eucalyptus.auth.euare.EuareService:2272 (null)
2. Component that caused exception is: DefaultJavaComponent{Euare.component}. Message payload is of type: CreateUserType (org.mule.component.ComponentException)
  org.mule.component.DefaultComponentLifecycleAdapter:352 (http://www.mulesoft.org/docs/site/current3/apidocs/org/mule/component/ComponentException.html)
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Root Exception stack trace:
com.eucalyptus.auth.euare.EuareException: Non-sysadmin can not have delegation access to
        at com.eucalyptus.auth.euare.EuareService.getRealAccount(EuareService.java:2272)
        at com.eucalyptus.auth.euare.EuareService.createUser(EuareService.java:756)
        at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke0(Native Method)
    + 3 more (set debug level logging or '-Dmule.verbose.exceptions=true' for everything)

I confirmed that if I remove that DelegateAccount value, the create call works. This occurred on the 5.175 host, but not our 5.150 host which has 4.1 packages. Looks like service API change not communicated to us. :-/
I'll fix all places where DelegateAccount is not used, but set to empty string.
The euare service behaviour change is caused by the fix for EUCA-7315 which means services can now distinguish between empty and missing parameters in post requests)
I'm changing this from a blocker since the service change was backed out for 4.1.1 and will be included in 4.2.
[~dkavanagh], This is no longer an issue in 4.1.1 since the EUCA fix was reverted. We should change both affected version and fix version to 4.2
We discussed still fixing the console side to be ready for 4.2, but I'm perfectly fine doing the work for 4.2 instead to minimize 4.1.1 changes.

In testing this, there's the obvious case that this ticket was written about, but the code touched was throughout the user section of code and for user and account policy handling. Those were places where DelegateAccount was passed in the API, so I tested as much of the user functionality as I could think to and I think a little more attention to the entire set of user functionality is important to ensure no regressions.
